snippet: Getulio Perdomo arrived in New York in 2006, leaving his daughter Daysi in Honduras. He later learned she had impaired hearing, and he grew fearful for her safety.
abstract: Getulio Perdomo of Far Rockaway, Queens, receives help from Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York in order to legalize immigration status of his daughter Daysi and enroll her in school for deaf students; Catholic Charities is one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
